result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antoine Maurice Hatchett

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Antoine Maurice Hatchett in court with attorney Justin L. Singleton. William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case 2015CF638 for the purposes of sentencing.
Status conference scheduled for July 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antoine Maurice Hatchett in court with Attorney Justin L. Singleton.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
State is requesting adjournment for further final pre-trial as to Case# 15CF00638.  Court orders this case adjourned for status in Branch 28.
Clerk:  jms
Status conference scheduled for June 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Antoine Maurice Hatchett in court with Attorney Justin Singleton.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Defense counsel motion to adjourn the trial; State objects to the adjournment.  Statements to the Court.
Court grants motion to adjourn trial.  Jury trial of April 18 is vacated.
Court orders this case adjourned for status on the same dates as to Case# 15CF000638 in Branch 28.
Clerk:  jms
Status conference scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Antoine Maurice Hatchett in court with Attorney Justin Singleton.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Defense counsel filed motion to adjourn trial on January 28; statements to the Court.  No objection by the State.
Court will grant adjournment of trial.  Court orders jury trial vacated and this case adjourned for status on the final pre-trial and jury trial dates as to Case# 15CF000638.
Clerk:  jms
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antoine Maurice Hatchett in court with Attorney Justin Singleton.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Defense counsel requests adjournment of the trial.
Court orders case adjourned for further final pre-trial in Branch 28.  Case to remain scheduled for trial until the next court date.
Clerk:  jms
Status conference scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antoine Maurice Hatchett in court.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant arrived late in court and apologized to the court.
Court orders stayed bench warrant withdrawn.
Defendant given next court date.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney Justin Singleton in court.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Defense counsel informs Court that he has just been appointed to this case as Atty. Cimpl-Wiemer is no longer with the Public Defender's office.

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the end of business today.
Court orders case adjourned for status in Branch 28; case to remain scheduled for jury trial until the next court date.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Antoine Maurice Hatchett in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a Jury Trial.  Defendant's pending felony matter has been set for a jury trial.  This matter to follow with defendant's pending felony as a status.  Status conference scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Antoine Maurice Hatchett in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Maureen Ami Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter to follow along with defendant's pending felony matter.

Parties requested that this matter be a part of a global resolution with case #15CF638 which is before Judge Brash in Branch 21. Branch 21 will accept this case. The jury trial date of 8/31/2015 before Branch 24 is removed.

Defendant Antoine Maurice Hatchett in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Daniel Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant has pending cases before Judge Brash, Branch 21.  This court has no objection to this case being tranferred to Judge Brash as part of a global resolution, if accepted.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on August 31, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 24.

Defendant Antoine Maurice Hatchett in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant has a pending felony matter before Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defense is working towards resolving these matters globally.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antoine Maurice Hatchett in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has a pending matter in Br. 21.  Partiess attempting a global resolution.  Status conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM018862  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04-10-15

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant Antoine Maurice Hatchett not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  The defendant has a pending felony before Judge Brash, Branch 21.  This court has no objection to this case being transferred to Judge Brash, Branch 21 as part of a global resolution.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Antoine Maurice Hatchett in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Antoine Maurice Hatchett in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
OTP
